type.title: Datasource Type
type.description: Datasource type supported by the selected connector type.

pipeline.title: Pipeline ID
pipeline.description: Name of an existing index pipeline for processing documents.

type_description.title: Type Description
type_description.default: Connector for Google Drive file storage. To use this connector, you must first register an application with access to the Drive API via the Google Developer Console at http://console.developers.google.com/project.

parserId.title: Parser
parserId.description: Parser used when parsing raw content. For some connectors, a configuration to 'retry' parsing if an error occurs is available as an advanced setting

refreshAll.title: Recrawl all items
refreshAll.description: Set to true to always recrawl all items found in the crawldb.

startLinks.title: Start Links
startLinks.description: The IDs of the folders or files to crawl. For example if the URL to your folder is https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B1u0p7N096R6MWgma3gwUj4j, then enter 0B1u0p7N096R6MWgma3gwUj4j here. To crawl the entire Google Drive, enter the special value 'root'.

collection.title: Collection
collection.description: Collection documents will be indexed to.

db.title: Connector DB
db.description: Type and properties for a ConnectorDB implementation to use with this datasource.

type.title: Implementation Class Name
type.description: Fully qualified class name of ConnectorDb implementation.

inlinks.title: Process Inlinks?
inlinks.description: Keep track of incoming links. This negatively impacts performance and size of DB.

aliases.title: Process Aliases?
aliases.description: Keep track of original URI-s that resolved to the current URI. This negatively impacts performance and size of DB.

inv_aliases.title: Process Inverted Aliases?
inv_aliases.description: Keep track of target URI-s that the current URI resolves to. This negatively impacts performance and size of DB.

dedupe.title: Dedupe documents
dedupe.description: If true, documents will be deduplicated. Deduplication can be done based on an analysis of the content, on the content of a specific field, or by a JavaScript function. If neither a field nor a script are defined, content analysis will be used.

dedupeField.title: Dedupe field
dedupeField.description: Field to be used for dedupe. Define either a field or a dedupe script, otherwise the full raw content of each document will be used.

dedupeScript.title: Dedupe script
dedupeScript.description: Custom javascript to dedupe documents. The script must define a 'genSignature(content){}' function, but can use any combination of document fields. The function must return a string.

dedupeSaveSignature.title: Save dedupe signature
dedupeSaveSignature.description: If true,the signature used for dedupe will be stored in a 'dedupeSignature_s' field. Note this may cause errors about 'immense terms' in that field.

delete.title: Delete dead URIs
delete.description: Set to true to remove documents from the index when they can no longer be accessed as unique documents.

deleteErrorsAfter.title: Fetch failure allowance
deleteErrorsAfter.description: Number of fetch failures to tolerate before removing a document from the index. The default of -1 means no fetch failures will be removed.

fetchThreads.title: Fetch threads
fetchThreads.description: The number of threads to use during fetching. The default is 5.

emitThreads.title: Emit threads
emitThreads.description: The number of threads used to send documents from the connector to the index pipeline. The default is 5.

chunkSize.title: Fetch batch size
chunkSize.description: The number of items to batch for each round of fetching. A higher value can make crawling faster, but memory usage is also increased. The default is 1.

fetchDelayMS.title: Fetch delay
fetchDelayMS.description: Number of milliseconds to wait between fetch requests. The default is 0. This property can be used to throttle a crawl if necessary.

refreshStartLinks.title: Recrawl start links
refreshStartLinks.description: Set to true to recrawl items specified in the list of start links.

refreshErrors.title: Recrawl errors
refreshErrors.description: Set to true to recrawl items that failed during the last crawl.

refreshOlderThan.title: Recrawl age
refreshOlderThan.description: Number of seconds to recrawl items whose last fetched date is longer ago than this value.

refreshIDPrefixes.title: Recrawl ID prefixes
refreshIDPrefixes.description: A prefix to recrawl all items whose IDs begin with this value.

refreshIDRegexes.title: Recrawl ID regexes
refreshIDRegexes.description: A regular expression to recrawl all items whose IDs match this pattern.

refreshScript.title: Recrawl script
refreshScript.description: A JavaScript function ('shouldRefresh()') to customize the items recrawled.

forceRefresh.title: Force recrawl
forceRefresh.description: Set to true to recrawl all items even if they have not changed since the last crawl.

forceRefreshClearSignatures.title: Clear signatures
forceRefreshClearSignatures.description: If true, signatures will be cleared if force recrawl is enabled.

retryEmit.title: Retry emits
retryEmit.description: Set to true for emit batch failures to be retried on a document-by-document basis.

depth.title: Max crawl depth
depth.description: Number of levels in a directory or site tree to descend for documents.

maxItems.title: Max items
maxItems.description: Maximum number of documents to fetch. The default (-1) means no limit.

failFastOnStartLinkFailure.title: Fail crawl if start links are invalid
failFastOnStartLinkFailure.description: If true, when Fusion cannot connect to any of the provided start links, the crawl is stopped and an exception logged.

crawlDBType.title: Crawl database type
crawlDBType.description: The type of crawl database to use, in-memory or on-disk.

commitAfterItems.title: Commit After This Many Items
commitAfterItems.description: Commit the crawlDB to disk after this many items have been received. A smaller number here will result in a slower crawl because of commits to disk being more frequent; conversely, a larger number here will cause a resumed job after a crash to need to recrawl more records.

initial_mapping.title: Initial field mapping
initial_mapping.description: Provides mapping of fields before documents are sent to an index pipeline.

skip.title: Skip This Stage
skip.description: Set to true to skip this stage.

label.title: Label
label.description: A unique label for this stage.

condition.title: Condition
condition.description: Define a conditional script that must result in true or false. This can be used to determine if the stage should process or not.

retentionMappings.title: Field Retention
retentionMappings.description: Fields that should be kept or deleted

field.title: Field
field.description: The name of the field to operate on.

operation.title: Operation
operation.description: The type of operation to perform: keep (default) or delete

updateMappings.title: Field Value Updates
updateMappings.description: Values that should be added to or set on a field. When a value is added, any values previously on the field will be retained. When a value is set, any values previously on the field will be overwritten.

field.title: Field
field.description: The name of the field to operate on.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value to add to or set on the field.

operation.title: Operation
operation.description: The type of operation to perform: add (default) or set.

translationMappings.title: Field Translations
translationMappings.description: Fields that should be moved or copied to another field. When a field is moved, the values from the source field are moved over to the target field and the source field is removed. When a field is copied, the values from the source field are copied over to the target field and the source field is retained.

source.title: Source Field
source.description: The name of the field to operate on.

target.title: Target Field
target.description: The name of the target field.

operation.title: Operation
operation.description: The type of operation to perform: copy (default) or move.

unmappedRule.title: Unmapped Fields
unmappedRule.description: Fields not mapped by the above rules. By default, any remaining fields will be kept on the document.

fieldToMoveValuesTo.title: Move
fieldToMoveValuesTo.description: Move all unmapped field values to this field

fieldToCopyValuesTo.title: Copy
fieldToCopyValuesTo.description: Copy all unmapped field values to this field

valueToAddToUnmappedFields.title: Add
valueToAddToUnmappedFields.description: Add this value to all unmapped fields

valueToSetOnUnmappedFields.title: Set
valueToSetOnUnmappedFields.description: Set this value on all unmapped fields

f.maxSizeBytes.title: Maximum file size (bytes)
f.maxSizeBytes.description: Maximum size (in bytes) of documents to fetch or -1 for unlimited file size.

f.minSizeBytes.title: Minimum file size (bytes)
f.minSizeBytes.description: Minimum size, in bytes, of documents to fetch.

f.addFileMetadata.title: Add file metadata
f.addFileMetadata.description: Set to true to add information about documents found in the filesystem to the document, such as document owner, group, or ACL permissions.

f.index_items_discarded.title: Index discarded document metadata
f.index_items_discarded.description: Enable to index discarded document metadata

f.fs.enableSecurityTrimming.title: Enable Security Trimming
f.fs.enableSecurityTrimming.description: Enable indexing and query-time security-trimming of google users)

f.fs.userSearchQuery.title: User Search Query
f.fs.userSearchQuery.description: Google drive crawl works by first getting a list of users, then crawling them. The User Search Query property lets you customize the query of users to fetch. See this link https://developers.google.com/admin-sdk/directory/v1/guides/search-users#fields for formats. Separate each query with a comma. Example: email:a*,email:b*,email:c*

f.fs.userExcludeList.title: User Exclude List
f.fs.userExcludeList.description: By default, all users' files are crawled. Enter a comma-separated list of usernames (email addresses) to exclude from the crawl. If the last character of the email address is an '*', then all email addresses that start with that prefix will be excluded.

f.fs.defaultDomain.title: Default domain for Google Drive
f.fs.defaultDomain.description: For Google Drive security trimming to work, the username must be of form username@domain. During the security trimming query stage, this default domain will be applied to the security trimming user names in the case that they do not have 'username@domain' format.

f.fs.applyGroupSecurityFiltering.title: Apply Group Security Filtering
f.fs.applyGroupSecurityFiltering.description: Check this box if you want to query the Google Directory API to fetch a users' Google groups during security trimming stage. These group names, once indexed, can be used to filter search results by Google Group.

security_filter_cache.title: Enable security filter cache
security_filter_cache.description: Cache of document access control rules.

cache_expiration_time.title: Security cache expiration time
cache_expiration_time.description: Time in seconds before the security filter cache expires.

retainOutlinks.title: Retain links in the crawldb
retainOutlinks.description: Set to true for links found during fetching to be stored in the crawldb. This increases precision in certain recrawl scenarios, but requires more memory and disk space.

aliasExpiration.title: Alias expiration
aliasExpiration.description: The number of crawls after which an alias will expire. The default is 1 crawl.

f.fs.clientID.title: Google Drive OAuth Client ID
f.fs.clientID.description: Google OAuth Client ID for a registered application with access to the Drive API.

f.fs.clientSecret.title: Google Drive OAuth Client Secret
f.fs.clientSecret.description: Google OAuth Client Secret for the registered application.

f.fs.refreshToken.title: Google Drive OAuth Refresh Token
f.fs.refreshToken.description: OAuth Refresh Token to allow re-authorization of the connector to the Drive API.

f.fs.serviceAccountId.title: Service Account ID
f.fs.serviceAccountId.description: For Service Account configuration - specifies the Service Account ID to use to connect Fusion to Google Drive.

f.fs.serviceAccountPrivateKey.title: Service account JSON private key contents
f.fs.serviceAccountPrivateKey.description: For Service Account configuration - specifies the private key file in JSON format. Open the private key json file (from Google api console) with a text editor, select all the text, copy, then paste into this text box. This private key is treated as a password meaning it is encrypted and is not visible in plain text when editing.

f.fs.serviceAccountEmail.title: Service Account Email
f.fs.serviceAccountEmail.description: For Service Account configuration only - NOTE: Required only when 'Apply Group Security Filtering' is checked. This service account email must be assigned to your Google project as a Service Actor in the console. It must have ability to list groups for a user, list users, and read google drive content.

f.fs.serviceAccountPrivateKeyFile.title: Service Account P12 Private Key File
f.fs.serviceAccountPrivateKeyFile.description: For Service Account configuration - specifies the private key file in P12 private key format.

f.fs.serviceAccountPrivateKeyFilePasswor.title: Service Account P12 Private Key Password.
f.fs.serviceAccountPrivateKeyFilePasswor.description: For Service Account configuration - specifies the private key file in P12 private key format.

f.fs.extraFileFieldsToIndex.title: Extra File fields to index
f.fs.extraFileFieldsToIndex.description: Google Drive by default will only index "id,createdTime,modifiedTime,size,name,description,mimeType,owners,permissions,webContentLink,webViewLink,fileExtension,trashed,parents". You can specify additional fields to index here. Note: You can only specify top level fields. Such as "capabilities". Specifying sub fields like "capabilities(canAddChildren,canRename)" will result in an error.

f.fs.mime_type_includes.title: Mime Type Includes
f.fs.mime_type_includes.description: A comma-separated list of the Mime types to include in this crawl. Includes supercede excludes.

f.fs.mime_type_excludes.title: Mime Type Excludes
f.fs.mime_type_excludes.description: A comma-separated list of the Mime types to exclude from this crawl. NOTE: This is only used if the "Mime Type Includes" field is empty.

f.fs.additional_item_filters.title: Additional Item Filters
f.fs.additional_item_filters.description: In https://developers.google.com/drive/v3/web/search-parameters#fn4 there are additional search parameters you can add to filter the files returned by google to be indexed. Example: modifiedTime > '2012-06-04T12:00:00'

f.fs.indexTrash.title: Index trash
f.fs.indexTrash.description: Set to true to index files in users Trash folders

f.fs.connectTimeout.title: Google Drive Connect timeout (ms)
f.fs.connectTimeout.description: Determines how long, in milliseconds, a request to the Google Drive API is allowed to take to connect prior to timing out

f.fs.readTimeout.title: Google Drive read timeout (ms)
f.fs.readTimeout.description: Determines how long, in milliseconds, a request to the Google Drive API is allowed to attempt to read content prior to timing out

f.fs.RecrawlCollectionName.title: Incremental crawling collection name
f.fs.RecrawlCollectionName.description: The collection name for incremental crawling

diagnosticMode.title: Diagnostic mode
diagnosticMode.description: Enable to print more detailed information to the logs about each request.

parserRetryCount.title: Max Parser Retries
parserRetryCount.description: The maximum number of times the configured parser will try getting content before giving up
